title: 111_hr946
content: The "Plain Writing Act of 2010" aims to enhance Federal agencies' communication with the public by promoting clear and understandable government documents necessary for obtaining benefits, services, or filing taxes. The "Plain Writing Act of 2010" requires Federal agencies to use clear, concise, and well-organized language in all communications, excluding regulations. Agencies must designate officials to oversee implementation and communicate the requirements to employees within 9 months of the Act's enactment. The "Plain Writing Act of 2010" mandates Federal agencies to train employees in plain writing, establish compliance oversight processes, maintain a plain writing section on their website, and designate points-of-contact for public input. The website section must inform the public of compliance and provide a feedback mechanism. The "Plain Writing Act of 2010" requires agencies to use plain writing in documents and establish a mechanism for public input on agency implementation and reports. The Director of the Office of Management and Budget will issue guidance on implementation within 6 months of enactment. Before official guidance is issued, agencies can follow the Plain Language Action and Information Network's writing guidelines or the agency head's consistent guidance. Agencies must report their compliance plans within 9 months of the Act's enactment and provide annual compliance reports thereafter. SEC. 6. JUDICIAL REVIEW AND ENFORCEABILITY. There shall be no judicial review of compliance with this Act. No provision of this Act creates enforceable rights. SEC. 7. BUDGETARY EFFECTS OF PAYGO LEGISLATION. Budgetary effects will be determined by the latest statement for compliance with the Statutory Pay-As-You-Go Act.
